intro: Uranostachys teucrium, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Uranostachys teucrium is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
